buildings

Class Building

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • buildings.Building
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Base, Converter, Engineering, Farm, MethanePlant, MineBuilding, SolarPlant

    public abstract class Building
extends java.util.Observable
    A Building is an abstract class representing any static object we can place on the Map. In particular, it has a size and location, often as well as a function it performs each game loop.
    Author:
    Team Rosetta

    • Constructor Detail

      • Building

        public Building(int locX,
        int locY,
        int wid,
        int len,
        int cap,
        java.lang.String name,
        BuildingEnum type)
        Parameters:
        locX - - The x location of the top left of the Building on the Map
        locY - - The y location of the top left of the Building on the Map
        wid - - The width of the Building.
        len - - The length (or height) of the Building.
        cap - - The maximum amount of any given Resource that can be held by the Building.
        name - - The name of the Building.
        type - - Each building has a BuildingEnum to which it is tied in order to best interact with the Tile and Map.

    • Method Detail

      • executeOnBuilding

        public abstract void executeOnBuilding(Map map)
        Each Building has actions needing to be performed each game loop. These are performed in the executeOnBuilding method.
        Parameters:
        map - - Most functions affect or need the Map.

      • addDrone

        public boolean addDrone(Drone drone)
        This method fairly evidently adds a Drone to the Building. Oftentimes, a Drone needs to be inside the building for some function, such as charging. This helps track that.
        Parameters:
        drone - - The Drone to be added to the list of Drones currently in the Building.
        Returns:
        boolean - True if a Drone is successfully added, false otherwise.

      • removeDrone

        public void removeDrone(Drone drone)
        As per the addDrone method, a method is needed to subsequently remove a Drone
        Parameters:
        drone - - The Drone to be removed for the list of Drones.

      • canBuild

        public boolean canBuild(Tile startTile)
        This method checks the Map to ensure each Tile in the appropriate size of the Building can be built upon, ie, is not mountainous or waterlogged.
        Parameters:
        startTile - - The top left Tile on which will be built.
        Returns:
        boolean - True if no Tile checked has any property prohibiting building, false otherwise.

      • getEmptyTile

        public Tile getEmptyTile()
        This method checks to see if any Tile making up the Building is empty, ie, does not have a Drone. This allows a space for new Drones to be placed.
        Returns:
        Tile - The first empty Tile.
